Description: Shoulder and body fragment probably of North Ionian black-figured pottery krater. On the shoulder, pendant lotus and bud ornament incised into the black-glazed ground; below, in black-figure, a panther to right; its head remains; filling ornament to left and perhaps to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit: 'Probably part of the same vessel as Oxford G 119.42 (CVA Great Britain 9: pl. 4 fig.29; Samos 6.1, pl.115 no.943).'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 11, no. 32 pl. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.908)
